actionList.info: Build widget will be removed from sidebars of all content types
This will not modify your Netlify sites. You may want to remove unneeded deploy notifications and build hooks from your Netlify site.

description:
### About the app

The Netlify App gives content editors control over static site builds and makes the process more transparent.

---

### This app provides the following functionality:

- triggers Netlify builds with a simple click in the sidebar
- displays build status so editors don't preview outdated sites
- brings Netlify functionality into the Contentful web app
- makes it possible to configure on a per-content-type level

---

### To use this app, you need:

- a static site based on a service such as Gatsby, Middleman or Hugo
- your site configured to load content from Contentful and its code pushed to a remote repository, such as GitHub or Gitlab
- a Netlify setup where the site is connected to the remote repository and enabled for continuous deployment

---

### Screenshots

![Netlify config](//images.ctfassets.net/lpjm8d10rkpy/4Rf8yoGPw4AQwdMboiVwhF/a0a9a8b8e73a5ace1fdf78adebc24a49/apps-netlify-site-setup.b4a24a69c0.png)

![Netlify sidebar](//images.ctfassets.net/lpjm8d10rkpy/RrSqXTcdlpfkPt7sJzkEb/57172d0fd3eaa36a5ab90e7d183ed171/apps-netlify-sidebar.0ffd73e12b.png)
permissions:

The app will be able to manage this environment and any content in it.

You can revoke access at any time by uninstalling the app.
tagLine: Easily build and preview Netlify sites directly from Contentful
title: Netlify

actionList.info: This will not remove the variation container content type or any created entries. Please remove them manually if they are no longer needed.

description:
### About the Optimizely app

⭐️This app is available to customers on an enterprise plan.⭐️

The Optimizely app is a new and simple way to run experiments inside Contentful. It connects your content in Contentful with experiments in Optimizely. Marketers can run more experiments and obtain better insights faster.

---

### Features:

- Run A/B tests or multivariate tests  on structured content (copy, components, layouts and pages)
- Allow marketers to be more independent from developers
- Enable marketers to act on results and make a winning variation the new default
- Reduce the amount of manual work needed to set up experiments

---

### Installation:

Installing this app will:

- Create a new content type called "Variation Container" 
- Create "Variation Container" entries
- Read your projects, experiments and variations from Optimizely

---

### Requirements:

- A __Contentful enterprise plan__ with a space
- An __Optimizely Full Stack__ plan with access to the REST API
- A small proxy that combines data from Contentful and Optimizely [(view docs)](https://www.contentful.com/developers/docs/extensibility/apps/optimizely/)
- A content type with a reference field

---

### Screenshots:

![Optimizely editor](//images.ctfassets.net/lpjm8d10rkpy/6BKTGsRNAzlQgllHDclqYe/ad9bad07083d102d1deff54a6a62e57f/optimizely-editor.png)
permissions:
__Optimizely app__ is asking for permissions to access this Contentful environment.

The app will be able to manage this environment and any content in it.

You can revoke access at any time by uninstalling the app.
tagLine: Enable experimentation of structured content with Optimizely
title: Optimizely

description:
### About the Cloudinary app 

After you’ve installed the Cloudinary app, you can easily reference assets hosted on Cloudinary directly inside the Contentful web app.

The app is a widget that allows editors to select media from their Cloudinary account. Simply click __Select or upload a file on Cloudinary__ and select the assets you want to be referenced from your entry.

---

### Features:
- Directly link your assets on Cloudinary from your Contentful entries
- Browse your collection on Cloudinary
- Preview selected assets in Contentful
- Standard JSON based asset reference format

---

### Requirements:

To use this app, you will need:

- An account with [Cloudinary](https://cloudinary.com)
- The __cloud name__ of your Cloudinary account
- The __API key__ of your Cloudinary account
- A content type with a field of type Object to hold the references to Cloudinary

You can find both cloud name and API key on your [Cloudinary dashboard](https://cloudinary.com/console).


---

### Screenshots:

![Cloudinary dialog](//images.ctfassets.net/lpjm8d10rkpy/4QAxpe5mbLZWkTAWucplJ4/1155818e1422f30fac24a51aab302670/apps-cloudinary-dialog.png)
permissions:
__Cloudinary app__ is asking for permissions to access this Contentful environment.

The app will be able to manage this environment and any content in it.

You can revoke access at any time by uninstalling the app.
tagLine: Reference assets from Cloudinary's digital asset management systems
title: Cloudinary

description:
### About the Bynder app 

After you’ve installed the Bynder app, you can easily reference assets hosted on Bynder directly inside the Contentful web app.

The app is a widget that allows editors to select media from their Bynder account. Simply click __Select or upload a file on Bynder__ and select the assets you want to be referenced from your entry.

---

### Features:
- Directly link your assets on Bynder from your Contentful entries
- Browse your collection on Bynder
- Preview selected assets in Contentful
- Standard JSON based asset reference format

---

### Requirements:

To use this app, you will need:

- An account with [Bynder](https://www.bynder.com)
- The URL of your Bynder account
- A content type with a field of type JSON object to hold the references to Bynder


---

description:
### About the Dropbox app 

After you’ve installed the Dropbox app, you can easily reference assets stored in your Dropbox account directly inside the Contentful web app.
Simply click __Select or upload a file on Dropbox__ and select the assets you want to be referenced from your entry.

---

### Features:
- Directly link your assets in Dropbox from your Contentful entries
- Browse your Dropbox account
- Preview selected assets in Contentful
- Standard JSON based asset reference format

---

### Requirements:

To use this app, you will need:

- An account with [Dropbox](https://www.dropbox.com)
- A content type with a field of type JSON object to hold the references to Dropbox assets


---

### Screenshots:

![Dropbox screenshot](//images.ctfassets.net/lpjm8d10rkpy/5uQPU1n35hheQmxg7CeMfx/95355daf5e17e7384e45ca37923722e3/Screen_Shot_2019-11-13_at_15.04.34.png?w=1000)

description:
### About the Frontify app:

With the Frontify app, you can simplify your workflow by accessing your brand assets from within the Contentful web app.
Simply click Select files from Frontify to select the assets you want to reference from your entry.

### Features:

* Directly link your assets on Frontify from your Contentful entries
* Browse your assets on Frontify
* Preview selected assets in Contentful
* Standard JSON based asset reference format

### Requirements:

To use this app, you will need:
* An existing [Frontify](https://www.frontify.com/) enterprise account
* The URL of your Frontify account
* A content type with a field of type JSON object to hold the references to Frontify

### Screenshots:

![contentful-frontify](//images.ctfassets.net/lpjm8d10rkpy/5onQHIH2JzKegzYZs2bWME/6f80663fdd4b801f5f3185798741e898/contentful-frontify.png?w=1000)

You can revoke access at any time by uninstalling the app.
title: Frontify

This will remove the Image Focal Point widget from the entry editor

description:
### About the Image Focal Point app 

The Image Focal Point app allows you to set a focal point for an image, which you can use to achieve better cropping amongst different devices and screen sizes.

During the installation the app sets up a content type you can use for your images with focal point data and provides you with a widget to set the focal point.

---

### Screenshots:
![apps-image-focal-point-dialog](//images.ctfassets.net/lpjm8d10rkpy/2TuSk1vWvUU0SJ8O5Qsz9a/51ce3e4c6b1d8fab44171ebd22efbdfa/Optimized-apps-image-focal-point-cover.png)
